As an elder, I must say that I find it quite amusing that some young whippersnapper would think themselves capable of contributing to their job. Why, back in my day, we didn't have the luxury of job searching or finding a place to "add value to." No sir, we worked hard and worked smart, and we didn't need any fancy job titles or paychecks to prove our worth. We were proud of the work we did, and we didn't need anyone's approval or recognition.

Now, I'm not saying that the young folks these days are lazy or entitled. No, no, no. I'm sure they're doing the best they can with what they've got. But let me tell you, it's a different world out there now. Everyone's in such a rush to get somewhere, to achieve something. But I digress. The point is, the young twenty-something in the article may have found a new job, but I'm the one who's truly contributing to society. I may not have a paycheck or a fancy title, but I've got something they'll never have - experience, wisdom, and a wealth of knowledge. And I'm not afraid to share it with anyone who'll listen.
